meanings.definition: To speak or act in the manner of a demagogue.
meanings.sent1: During the speech, the politician demagogued the crowd with promises he couldn't keep.
meanings.sent2: The candidate demagogued the audience by making exaggerated claims about his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The comedian demagogued the audience by pretending to be a famous politician.
meanings.sent4: She demagogued her way through the debate, using emotional appeals to sway the voters.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demagogued the students into participating by offering extra credit.

meanings.definition: To manipulate or appeal to the emotions and prejudices of the people for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The company demagogued the consumers by creating false urgency to buy their products.
meanings.sent2: The cult leader demagogued his followers into giving up all their possessions.
meanings.sent3: The magician demagogued the audience by using psychological tricks to manipulate their choices.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor demagogued the viewers by sensationalizing the story to boost ratings.
meanings.sent5: The scam artist demagogued the elderly couple into giving away their life savings.
